div1.p: The record card cites a request from Hunt for a copy of a photograph of Reed for use in a lecture “The Story of Two Mosquitoes.”

div1.head: Surgeon General's Office Record Card, December 10, 1908
div1.p:
5.
DEC 10 1908
Dr. C.C. Hunt
Dixon, Ill. Nov 14, 08

Requests copy of photo-
graph of Dr. Walter Reed,
for use in a lecture he is
preparing on “The Story of
Two Mosquitoes”
FILED

5
Nov. 16, 1908.
Dr. C.C. Hunt, 119 Galena
Ave., Dixon, Ill. My dear Doctor Hunt:
The Surgeon General has requested me
to acknowledge the receipt of your
favor of the 14th instant, and in reply
to inform you that a photograph of the
late Walter Reed has been mailed to-
day under separate cover.

There is a photograph of Laveran
in a British Medical Journal on file
in the Surgeon General's Library. An
affort will be made to have this re-
produced, and if successful it will be
forwarded to you in a very few days.

The Surgeon General asks me to say
that it gives him great pleasure to
assist you in popularizing the great
work of these two army surgeons.

M.W.I., Maj., Med. Corps, U.S.A.
B.M.I.
